title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
How I Got Here





Greener on the Other Side - ODI Global Report



April 2025: Published ‚ÄúGreener on the other side?‚Äù using AI to classify 18,000 Chinese lending projects
After publication: Professor Carlos Oya reached out
Today: First time teaching a workshop on LLMs, but figured it was a great way to gather my thoughts on something I‚Äôve been thinking about a lot

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
China‚Äôs Green Lending Reality

Trends in Chinese overseas lending by project typeWhat we discovered: Despite ‚ÄúGreen Belt and Road‚Äù rhetoric, minimal actual renewable energy financing
LLM Best Practices: No established best practices. We are trying to start that conversation

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
My Take on AI


There are real problems with AI ‚ö†Ô∏è

Bias and training data issues
Hallucinations and false confidence
Serious social & ethical issues


Despite this‚Ä¶ üí°

I believe AI can be a powerful tool for those of us who want to make the world a better place

Value I can add:

I‚Äôve spent a lot of time figuring out what works and what doesn‚Äôt. I can share my practical experience with you.

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
My Relevant AI Experience


ODI research project: 18,000 project classification in 15 hours vs.¬†1,500 hours manually for cost of $1.58.
Day job: Running Teal Insights, where we help Global South finance ministries navigate complex debt sustainability and climate investment challenges.
Our approach: Small team (US, Nigeria, Kenya) using AI tools heavily to amplify our impact in research and code development.
Building LLM products: To facilitate our research process and help countries avoid expensive consulting fees

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Other Relevant Experience


EM sovereign debt research analyst, Morgan Stanley Investment Management
Adjunct Lecturer, Johns Hopkins SAIS (teaching students to do real-world data analysis on financial and sustainability data)
Thought leadership on sovereign debt + sustainability, World Bank
Chinese debt restructuring & flows research, AidData
Big nerd ü§ì

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Who This Workshop Is For
Experienced researchers who want to explore how LLMs might enhance their work


Deep expertise in your research domain

Healthy skepticism about new technologies and their promises
No prior LLM knowledge or coding experience required
Interest in practical tools that could streamline routine research tasks
Your skepticism is justified‚ÄîLLMs have real limitations we‚Äôll address directly

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
This Workshop‚Äôs Goal

You can‚Äôt learn everything about AI in 2 hours.
This workshop aims to give you the mental, practical tools, and inspiration to get started

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
What You‚Äôll Leave With Today
Three Practical Tools


A mental model for how to us AI effectively and responsibly
Working prompts and systems you can use immediately

Validation strategies to maintain research integrity

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Our ‚ÄúFlipped‚Äù Approach


Live Session

Concept exploration & discussion
Hands-on activities in Part 2
Problem-solving together
Learning from each other


Your Reference Book

Detailed explanations
Extended examples
Enables live session to be more interactive


All details at: teal-insights.github.io/soas_llm_training

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Our Journey Together
Part 1: Foundations (20 min)
Understanding the research reality & building your mental model
Part 2: Practical Applications (70 min)
Hands-on tools & techniques with 3 activities
Part 3: Advanced Possibilities (15 min)
Case study & scaling considerations
Wrap-Up: Your Next Steps (15 min)
Action planning & Q&A

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Understanding the Research Reality
What we‚Äôre exploring: Why this matters & how to think about AI strategically

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
section: The Scale Problem We All Face
text:
The Scale Problem We All Face
The literature explosion

Too much to read, too little time

Your reality

Deep expertise, but finite time
Job, family, life outside research
Can‚Äôt read everything that looks relevant

üí¨ Chat: Share one research task you find tedious

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Approach to AI


‚ùå Avoiding

Replacing your critical thinking
Trusting AI without verification

Ignoring bias and limitations
Displacing human expertise


‚úÖ Amplifying

Your domain knowledge
Your analytical capabilities

Your research capacity
Your time for deep thinking


Key insight: AI handles routine so you focus on remarkable

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Mental Model: The ‚ÄúJagged Frontier‚Äù

What is AI good at?From Dell‚ÄôAcqua et al 2023
Inside the frontier: AI excels
Outside the frontier: AI struggles
The challenge: The boundary is invisible, unpredictable, and moving quickly

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
The Jagged Frontier in Action


Single prompt: ‚ÄúMake a painting of a dumpster fire in the style of Monet‚Äù



Made by ChatGPT in seconds



One hour of prompting: ‚ÄúMake a better jagged frontier visualization‚Äù



Non-sensical output after countless attempts



This is the jagged frontier: Seemingly similar tasks with wildly different AI performance

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Understanding the Frontier


Inside (AI excels)

Summarizing complex texts quickly
Pattern recognition across documents
First-draft generation
Code generation


Outside (AI struggles)

Understanding implicit context
Making ethical judgments
Recognizing what‚Äôs missing
Cultural and political subtext


Only YOU can find the ‚Äújagged frontier‚Äù for tasks that matter to you

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
The Collaborative Model
Think of LLMs as sophisticated research assistants with unique strengths and blind spots


Your Unique Value

Domain expertise & contextual understanding
Critical analysis & theoretical frameworks
Ethical judgment & interpretation


AI‚Äôs Unique Value

Processing large volumes quickly
Generating first drafts
Handling routine tasks
Providing different perspectives


The goal: AI amplifies your expertise, doesn‚Äôt replace it

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Finding Your Frontier
How to discover what works for your research:


Start with your own work: Test AI on papers you know intimately
Begin with low-stakes tasks: Where errors won‚Äôt matter much
Test systematically: Try similar but different tasks to map boundaries
Stay updated: The frontier is expanding rapidly but unevenly


Key principle: Which tasks in your workflow are slow, repetitive, or cognitively exhausting?
Try them with an LLM. Does it help or hinder?

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
section: Why This Matters: Democratizing Ambitious Research
text:
Why This Matters: Democratizing Ambitious Research
The bigger picture: Tools that enable more researchers to tackle urgent questions at scale


Previously required: Large research grants, teams of research assistants, months of work
Now possible: Two policy researchers with minimal budget accomplished analysis that traditionally required large, well-funded teams
What this enables: More ambitious, policy-relevant research while maintaining academic rigor
The promise: Not replacing researchers, but enabling more transparent and impactful research


We face urgent policy challenges around climate finance, development effectiveness, and global economic transitions

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Two Ways to Use AI


Web Interfaces (Our Focus)

Type questions, get answers
No coding required
Best for: Individual papers, exploration


APIs (Advanced)

Requires coding skills
Process thousands automatically
Best for: Large-scale projects


For most researchers starting with LLMs: Web interfaces are the better choice

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
The Big Three AI Providers


OpenAI (ChatGPT): Deep Research tool, strong reasoning
Anthropic (Claude): Excellent for coding, high-quality writing

Google (Gemini): Massive context window, built-in citations
Reality check: I pay for all three (~$20/month each). Each has unique strengths.
This landscape changes rapidly - what‚Äôs best today may not be tomorrow

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Why Gemini for Today
Context Window: How much text AI can process at once


Gemini: ~750,000 words (10-15 academic papers)
Others: ~150,000 words (2-3 papers)
Built-in citations: Automatic source references
Perfect for: Academic workflows with large documents


We‚Äôll explore other tools briefly, but Gemini is our main focus

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Key Takeaways from Foundations


The Challenge

Information overload in academic research
Limited time for comprehensive literature review
Need for strategic filtering and prioritization


Your Strategic Advantage

Understanding the jagged frontier
Collaborative approach: AI handles scale, you provide judgment
Tool selection based on your specific needs


Next: We‚Äôll put this into practice with hands-on tools and techniques

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Building Your Research Toolkit
What we‚Äôre building: Working prompts, custom assistants, and literature enhancement tools

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Your Learning Journey
üîß Activity 1: Professional Context (8 min)
Build foundation for all AI interactions
üîß Activity 2: Enhanced Prompting (10 min)
Transform vague requests into powerful prompts
üîß Activity 3: Literature Review Assistant (25 min)
Create reusable research assistant using a Gemini Gem
üìñ Book chapters: 4-6 provide provide more detail

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
The Power and the Problem
Large Language Models are powerful but not clairvoyant


Powerful: Can handle complex tasks that take humans hours or days
Not clairvoyant: Can‚Äôt read your mind or guess what you really need
Need sufficient information: The more context you provide, the better the output
Key insight: Quality of output depends heavily on quality of input

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
From Google to Collaborative Partner


‚ùå Google Search Approach

Few keywords
Browse results
Find what you need


‚úÖ AI Collaboration Approach

Detailed context
Specific instructions
Iterative refinement


Think of AI as a knowledgeable colleague who needs clear direction

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Anatomy of Effective Prompts
Essential components for research-quality outputs:


Context: Who you are, what you‚Äôre working on
Task: What specifically you want the AI to do
Format: How you want the output structured
Constraints: Limitations, requirements, things to avoid
Examples: Sample inputs/outputs when helpful


üìñ Detailed templates: Chapter 4

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
üîß Activity 1: Create Your Professional Context
Build Your AI Research Foundation (8 minutes)
What you‚Äôll do: 1. Go to gemini.google.com 2. Upload your CV, LinkedIn profile, or faculty bio 3. Use the prompt template (next slide) 4. Create reusable professional context
Why this matters: This becomes the foundation for all your AI interactions

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Professional Context Prompt Template
Please analyze my professional background and help me create a 
professional context for AI interactions. Based on my CV/profile, 
create a summary that includes:

## Domain Expertise & Background
[My main research areas, methodology preferences, key expertise]

## Current Roles & Affiliations  
[Current positions, institutional affiliations, responsibilities]

## Research Focus Areas
[Main research interests, current projects, regional expertise]

## Communication Style & Audience
[Who I typically write for, how I prefer to communicate findings]

## Technical Approach
[Specific tools, methods, analytical approaches I use]

Make this professional but concise - about 200-300 words total.

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Activity 1: Instructions


Upload your document: CV, LinkedIn, or faculty bio to Gemini
Paste the template: Copy the prompt from the previous slide
Review the output: Does it capture your expertise accurately?
Refine if needed: Ask for adjustments to better reflect your work
Save the result: You‚Äôll use this in our next activities



‚è±Ô∏è 8 minutes

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
The Difference Context Makes
Without context: Generic, surface-level responses
With context: Targeted, sophisticated assistance

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Two Powerful Prompt Enhancers
Add these to any prompt for better results:


‚ÄúPlease ask me clarifying questions‚Äù - Encourages AI to seek additional information rather than make assumptions
‚ÄúTell me when you‚Äôre unsure about something‚Äù - Reduces hallucinations by encouraging admission of uncertainty


These simple additions can save you from misleading responses

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Common Prompting Mistakes


‚ùå What Doesn‚Äôt Work

Treating AI like Google
Vague requests: ‚ÄúHelp me with X‚Äù
No quality control
Overwhelming with too much at once


‚úÖ What Works

Provide documents + ask for analysis
Specific tasks + output format
Ask for sources and reasoning
Break complex tasks into steps

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
üîß Activity 2: Enhanced Prompting Practice
From Vague to Powerful (10 minutes)
What you‚Äôll do:

Take your professional context from Activity 1
Choose a current research question you‚Äôre working on
Create a structured prompt using the template
Test it and refine

Goal: Experience the difference between generic and contextualized AI assistance

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Enhanced Prompting Template
[Paste your professional context from Activity 1]

## Current Research Question
[Describe what you're working on - paper, project, grant, etc.]

## Specific Request
I need help with [specific task]. Please:
- [What you want the AI to do]
- [How you want it formatted]
- [Any constraints or requirements]

## Additional Context
[Any relevant background, documents, or constraints]

Please ask me clarifying questions if you need more information, 
and tell me when you're unsure about something.

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Activity 2: Step-by-Step


Start with your context: Use the professional summary from Activity 1
Choose your research question: Something you‚Äôre currently working on
Be specific: What exactly do you want help with?
Add the enhancers: Ask for clarifying questions and uncertainty flags
Test and refine: Try it, see what happens, adjust as needed



‚è±Ô∏è 10 minutes

üí¨ Chat: Share your biggest ‚Äúaha‚Äù moment from improved prompting

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
The Art of Iterative Prompting
AI works best through conversation, not one-shot requests


Start broad: Get initial direction and framework
Drill down: Ask for specifics on the most interesting parts
Refine: Request adjustments to tone, format, or focus
Verify: Ask for sources, evidence, or reasoning


Example flow: Research question ‚Üí Initial analysis ‚Üí Specific methodology ‚Üí Alternative approaches ‚Üí Validation strategy

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Prompt Chaining for Complex Tasks
Break complex requests into sequential steps:


‚ùå All at once
‚ÄúAnalyze this email thread, identify key issues, and draft a response‚Äù

‚úÖ Step by step

First: Analyze and clarify
Then: Draft based on analysis


Why this works: Each step can be optimized, you maintain quality control, AI has clearer focus

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Building Your Prompt Library
As you develop effective prompts, save them:


Literature analysis: Templates for paper summaries
Research brainstorming: Question generation prompts
Writing enhancement: Revision and feedback requests
Email threads: Complex communication analysis
Grant applications: Proposal development assistance


üìñ Ready-to-use templates: Chapter 4 provides tested prompts for common research tasks

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
What You‚Äôve Built So Far


Tool 1: Professional Context

Reusable foundation for all AI interactions
Captures your expertise and communication style
Enables targeted, sophisticated assistance


Tool 2: Enhanced Prompting

Structured approach to AI requests
Quality control through verification
Iterative refinement process


Next: We‚Äôll enhance your literature review capabilities, then build specialized research assistants

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Literature Review Enhancement
The information deluge problem we all face


Explosion of research: Even narrow subfields are impossible to keep up with
Your reality: Job, family, life outside research - finite time
The challenge: Can‚Äôt read everything, can‚Äôt afford to miss important work


AI as intelligent filter: Help identify what deserves your limited attention

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
The Scale Advantage
Time mathematics for literature processing:


Traditional Reading

Academic paper: 40-80 minutes
100-page report: 3-5 hours
Weekly literature (10 papers): 7-13 hours


AI Processing

Paper summary: 30-60 seconds
100-page report analysis: 2-3 minutes
10-paper pattern analysis: 5-10 minutes


This isn‚Äôt about replacing careful reading‚Äîit‚Äôs about deciding what merits it

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
My Personal Literature Workflow
Step 1: Initial Filtering
[Add your professional context]

Please provide full citation information, then create a detailed 
structured summary including:
- Main argument or purpose
- Key findings or conclusions
- Important data, evidence, or examples
- Policy implications or practical applications
- Intended audience

Format as structured summary with clear headings.
Result: 95% of documents - summary gives me what I need. 5% - worth reading in detail

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Two Types of Translation
AI excels at bridging barriers:


1. Language Translation

Access research in other languages
Initial translations for relevance assessment
Professional translation for key sources


2. Cross-Disciplinary Translation

Bridge academic jargon differences
Access insights from related fields
Translate complex concepts to plain language


Both expand your research scope dramatically

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Cross-Disciplinary Translation Example
Prompt for bridging disciplines:
[Your professional context]

This paper is written for [source discipline] using terminology 
unfamiliar to [target discipline] researchers. Please:

1. Identify key concepts and findings
2. Explain them in plain language  
3. Suggest how insights might apply to [target discipline]
4. Highlight adaptable methodological approaches

Focus on practical applications, avoid oversimplification.
Real value: Access methodologies and insights trapped in other fields

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
üîß Activity 3: Literature Enhancement Practice
Test Your Literature Workflow (15 minutes)
What you‚Äôll do:

Choose a paper from your field (or upload one)
Use your professional context + literature summary prompt
Test cross-disciplinary translation: Try translating it into plain language understandable to someone outside your field.
Evaluate: Does this save time while maintaining quality?

Goal: Experience AI as literature processing amplifier

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Activity 3: Step-by-Step


Upload a paper: Something recent in your field
Use structured prompt: Professional context + literature summary template
Evaluate output: Does it capture what you need?
Test boundaries: Try with a paper from a related discipline
Refine approach: Adjust prompts based on what you learn



‚è±Ô∏è 15 minutes

üí¨ Chat: Share one insight AI helped you discover that you might have missed

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Critical Validation Strategies
Essential practices for literature AI:


Always verify key claims: Especially quantitative findings
Check citations: Ensure quotes aren‚Äôt taken out of context
Use for exploration: Identify promising papers, then read sections carefully
Cross-reference: Compare AI summaries with abstracts and conclusions
Professional translation: For sources central to your argument


Remember: AI helps you cast a wider net, human judgment determines what to keep

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
What Are Gems?
Now that you understand literature enhancement, let‚Äôs save this approach


Think of Gems as specialized research assistants

Google Gemini: Gems
Claude: Projects

ChatGPT: Custom GPTs
Same concept: Saved instructions for specific tasks


Benefits for literature work

Consistent approach across papers
No re-entering context each time
Specialized for your research needs
Can share with colleagues

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
section: üîß Activity 4: Create Your Literature Review Gem
text:
üîß Activity 4: Create Your Literature Review Gem
Build Your Specialized Research Assistant (10 minutes)
What you‚Äôll do:

Create a new Gem in Gemini
Use your professional context from Activity 1
Add your refined literature review approach from Activity 3
Test it with a new paper
Save for future use

Goal: Reusable literature processing system

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Literature Review Gem Template
# Literature Review Specialist - [Your Name]

[Your professional context from Activity 1]

## Your Role
Help me efficiently analyze academic papers, identify patterns, 
find research gaps, and synthesize findings.

## Analysis Approach
[Add your refined approach from Activity 3]

## Output Format
- Clear section headers with full citation
- Page numbers for key findings
- Methodological details when relevant
- Cross-disciplinary connections where applicable

## Quality Standards
- Maintain academic rigor
- Distinguish claims from empirical findings
- Note limitations and methodological concerns

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
What You‚Äôve Built Now


Tool 3: Literature Enhancement Workflow

Structured approach to paper processing
Cross-disciplinary translation capabilities
Time-saving while maintaining quality


Tool 4: Literature Review Gem

Reusable specialist assistant
Consistent high-quality analysis
Saves your refined approach


Next: Advanced tools and coding assistance

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Advanced Tools: Beyond Basic Chat
For when you need to analyze large document collections:


NotebookLM

Upload up to 300 documents
Ask questions across entire corpus
Exact citations to source material
Perfect for exploratory analysis


Deep Research Tools

AI conducts 15-20 minute research projects
Produces detailed 15-30 page reports
Available in ChatGPT, Claude, Perplexity
Good for initial topic exploration


üìñ Detailed guide: Chapter 7 for advanced tools

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
NotebookLM in Action





NotebookLM analyzing Chinese policy bank annual reports



Real example:

Financial analysis revealed China ExIM losses in 2017
Asked: ‚ÄúWhat caused the losses?‚Äù
Found exchange rate explanation with exact citations


Key insight: Use for exploration, verify with original sources

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Deep Research Reality Check
What they do well:

Comprehensive coverage of complex topics
Synthesis across multiple sources
Quality equivalent to skilled research assistant after a week

Important limitations:

Can be confidently wrong about specific facts
Limited access to academic databases
May miss recent developments
Always verify important claims

Best approach: Use for initial exploration, follow up with domain expertise

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Coding Assistance: The Bigger Opportunity
Many researchers work with data analysis code:


R, Python, Stata, SPSS, MATLAB
Whether you code yourself or supervise others
Wish you could move from Excel to more reproducible workflows
Face time-consuming debugging and learning curves


AI coding assistance can dramatically reduce time on routine tasks

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
The Coding Jagged Frontier


Inside (AI excels)

Standard data manipulation
Statistical analysis code
Explaining existing code
Generating documentation
Debugging common errors
Translating between languages


Outside (AI struggles)

Your specific research context
Domain-specific packages
Complex multi-step analyses
Performance optimization
Statistical method selection


The key: AI handles syntax, you provide the research logic

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
The ‚ÄúVibe Coding‚Äù Problem
What is ‚Äúvibe coding‚Äù?
AI generates code that looks professional and runs without errors, but:


Produces incorrect results
Uses functions that don‚Äôt exist
Mixes syntax from different languages
Works for simple cases but fails with real data


The 0-to-90% problem: AI quickly gets you 90% there, then you spend hours debugging the remaining 10%

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Best Practices for Research Coding
Strategic approach:


Use most advanced models - Pay for premium access ($20/month is worth it)
Start with your own expertise - Test AI on code you know well
Provide complete context - Include data structure, expected outputs, error messages
Break complex tasks into steps - Don‚Äôt ask for entire analysis at once
Always validate outputs - Check results against known answers


üìñ Comprehensive guide: Chapter 8 for coding best practices

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
R Tidyverse Example
Prompt for data analysis:
I'm analyzing survey data on household income and education. 
I have columns: household_id, income, education, region, year.

Using R tidyverse style with the base R pipe |>, help me:
1. Calculate median income by region and education level
2. Create a summary table showing trends over time
3. Generate a clean visualization for publication

Please include comments and use the tidyverse style guide.
Result: AI generates clean, documented code following your preferences

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
When AI Coding Shines
Dramatic speed improvements for:


Routine Tasks

Data cleaning and transformation
Standard statistical analyses
Creating visualizations
Writing documentation


Learning Acceleration

Explaining unfamiliar code
Bridging between languages
Discovering best practices
Understanding error messages


Real value: Frees you from syntax struggles to focus on research questions

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Moving Beyond Web Interfaces
Advanced coding environments:


Cursor IDE

AI-native code editor
Understands entire project context
Edits code in place
Runs and iterates based on results


GitHub Copilot

Autocomplete suggestions
Works in existing IDEs
Learns from your coding patterns
Integrates with development workflow


When you‚Äôre ready: These tools enable more sophisticated AI-assisted development

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Validation Strategies for AI Code
Essential practices:


Test with known data - Use datasets where you know expected results
Start small - Test functions with simple examples first
Manual verification - Check AI calculations against hand calculations
Cross-platform validation - Compare results across different tools
Peer review - Have colleagues examine AI-generated code


Remember: AI is a coding co-pilot, not an autopilot

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
What You‚Äôve Built Throughout Part 2


Foundations: Mental model + strategic tool selection
Practical Skills:

Professional context for all AI interactions
Enhanced prompting techniques
Literature review enhancement workflow
Custom research assistant (Gem)


Areas of Low-Hanging Fruit:

Text summarization: AI excels at processing and organizing information
Coding assistance: Dramatically faster for routine programming tasks
Translation: Both linguistic and cross-disciplinary
First-draft generation: Starting points for refinement


Next: Case study showing what becomes possible when you scale up

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
section: Case Study: Using LLMs at Scale
text:
Case Study: Using LLMs at Scale
What we‚Äôre exploring: How AI enables policy-relevant research at scale

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
The Policy Challenge
Understanding China‚Äôs Role in Financing the Energy Transition


China: Key source of lending to developing countries
Policy pronouncements about ‚ÄúGreen Belt and Road Initiative‚Äù
Emphasis on ‚Äúsmall and beautiful‚Äù projects
Shift from policy banks to commercial co-financing


Critical questions: Was China actually supporting green transition? Who was participating? What scale?

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
The Classification Challenge
18,000 Chinese overseas lending projects from AidData‚Äôs database


Categories needed:

üü¢ Green: Solar, wind, hydro, nuclear
üü´ Brown: Coal, oil, fossil fuels
üîò Grey: Indirect impacts (transmission)
‚ö™ Neutral: Non-energy projects


Traditional approach:

1,500 hours of work
$22,500 in research costs
Large grant funding required


Our result: Completed in 15 hours for $1.58

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
section: The Reality of Human vs.¬†LLM Classification
text:
The Reality of Human vs.¬†LLM Classification
Let‚Äôs be honest about manual classification at scale:


After a few hours, your eyes glaze over
Are you applying criteria consistently?
Are you coding the same way as yesterday? Last week?
Research assistants face the same challenges


LLMs bring endless patience and consistency

Apply same criteria to project 17,000 as to project 1
No fatigue, no drift in standards, no bad days
Your LLM didn‚Äôt stay out partying until 4 AM

Key insight: Not about perfection, but about good-enough accuracy with perfect consistency

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Why Keywords Failed, Context Succeeded
Example project: ‚ÄúDevelopment of 500MW solar power plant with backup diesel generator‚Äù


‚ùå Keyword Search

Sees ‚Äúdiesel‚Äù
Classifies as brown
Misses primary purpose


‚úÖ LLM Context Understanding

Reads entire description
Understands primary purpose
Recognizes backup as auxiliary
Correctly classifies as green


The advantage: LLMs understand context that keyword searches miss entirely

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Our Development Journey
Phase 1: Getting Started (5-10 examples)

Test basic concepts
Refine classification framework

Phase 2: Working Out Kinks (~30 examples)

Handle edge cases and mixed projects
Develop nuanced reasoning

Phase 3: Infrastructure Testing (100 projects)

Test API calls and error handling
Build processing pipelines

Phase 4: Validation Strategy (300 projects)

Test multiple models against human judgment
Measure reliability and accuracy

Phase 5: Full Implementation (18,000 projects)

Process complete dataset with confidence

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
What Made Our Approach Work
Multi-shot prompting: Showed AI how to reason through complex cases
Structured output: Required JSON format with confidence levels
Confidence calibration: AI assessed its own certainty

HIGH: Clear alignment with categories
MEDIUM: Some ambiguity but reasonable certainty
LOW: Significant uncertainty - flag for human review

Key insight: When AI said it was uncertain, it usually was

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Validation Strategy
Step 1: Inter-Model Agreement

Tested different LLMs on same projects
High agreement (85-95%) on most categories
Deepseek v3 emerged as best performer

Step 2: Human Validation Benchmark

300 projects manually classified by experts
91.8% agreement with human ratings
95.5% accuracy on green projects specifically


LLM Agreement Analysis

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
The Unexpected Challenge
All LLM providers do some type of content moderation.
Using Deepseek (an LLM from a Chinese AI lab) required ‚ÄúNon Traditional Debugging‚Äù to sanitize politically sensitive names.

Non-traditional debugging approach

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
What We Discovered

Trends in Chinese overseas lending by project typeKey findings challenged conventional wisdom:

Only $86.5 billion in green investments (5.8% of total)
No green surge over time despite policy rhetoric
Bifurcated co-financing networks - green and commercial financing remain separate

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
The Transformation of Research Possibilities
This wasn‚Äôt about doing the impossible

Large teams could have done this manually
It would have required major grant funding

This was about democratizing ambitious research
Key insight: AI handles mechanical tasks while humans focus on research design, validation, and interpretation

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Essential Lessons for Other Researchers
1. Start Simple, Build Complexity Gradually

Get basic cases working first
Add examples iteratively
Test infrastructure early
Plan validation upfront

2. Validation Is Everything

Test models against each other
Verify with human judgment
Always preserve original data
Document your methodology

3. Transparency Enables Progress

Share methods, code, and validation data
Others can build on your work
Contribute to methodological development

üìñ Full methodology: 27-page appendix + GitHub repository

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
The Bigger Picture
Democratizing Ambitious Research

We face urgent policy challenges

Tools that enable more researchers to tackle these questions at scale:

While maintaining academic rigor
With transparent methodology
Building on each other‚Äôs work

The promise: Not replacing expertise, but amplifying it to address urgent global challenges

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
section: What This Means for Your Research
text:
What This Means for Your Research
When you‚Äôre ready to scale up:


Web tools ‚Üí API development - What you‚Äôve learned applies to programmatic approaches
Small samples ‚Üí Large datasets - Tackle questions requiring comprehensive analysis
Individual papers ‚Üí Pattern recognition - Find insights across hundreds of documents
Limited scope ‚Üí Ambitious projects - Questions you couldn‚Äôt previously afford to pursue


The path forward: Build comfort with web interfaces, then consider scaling when your research questions demand it

title: AI for the Skeptical Scholar
text:
Looking Forward
Methodological challenges we all face:


Validation strategies for LLM-generated analysis
Transparency requirements for AI-assisted research
Best practices for handling provider constraints
Training programs for responsible AI use


This case study represents one approach - not perfect, but a contribution toward responsible, effective AI use in policy research
The conversation is just beginning - your research and methods will help shape how these tools evolve
